profiles:
Summary Matthew Harding is an Economist who conducts research on Applied Econometrics with a focus on the use of Big Data to answer crucial policy questions in Energy/Environment and Health/Nutrition. 
 
I aim to understand how individuals make consumption choices in a data rich environment, and 
quantify the individual and social welfare impact of their choices in areas such as Food Purchases/Nutrition/Health and Energy/Environment. Building on a rigorous foundation in econometric methods, I explore the potential of Big Data to estimate better models and predict the 
choices made by individuals, while taking into account both traditional economic models and recent 
developments in behavioral economics. I use large scale field experiments to understand the unintended social consequences of individual choices and the extent to which behavioral nudges and price based mechanisms can be used as cost-effective means of improving individual and social welfare. I rely on terabyte sized data sets on household energy consumption, food purchases and prescription records to build a comprehensive framework for understanding economic choices. I also develop cutting edge econometric methods for the practical analysis of Big Data econometric models using Bayesian and Quantile techniques, by focusing in particular on the role of unobserved heterogeneity in complex massive data. Summary I am an applied econometrician currently working as Chief Economist and Vice President for Amazon in Seattle, WA. Our team of PhD economists use applied econometrics to help Amazon better serve our customers and operate more efficiently. We have collaborated with other Amazonians to develop technically advanced but practical solutions in operations, pricing, forecasting, applied marketing and merchant services that currently power our platform. 
 
If you are searching for a position where you can apply econometrics and economic reasoning in a fast paced, but collaborative environment contact me! There are almost always positions available for world class data scientists with a knack for delivering results. 
 
Prior to working at Amazon, I was a full time academic working in applied econometrics and empirical industrial organization. I am a Research Fellow at the National Bureau of Economic Research and have served as a journal editor and thesis advisor. While in academia, I consulted to the Boston Consulting Group, the Federal Reserve System, the Law and Economics Consulting Group, the US Federal Trade Commission and served as an expert witness in antitrust and litigation.
